description: Learn Sketch, the Mac-only vector graphics editor that revolutionized digital product design.

slides.title: What is Sketch?
slides.content:
# Sketch ðŸ’Ž

The tool that started the modern UI design revolution (moving way from Photoshop).

- **Mac-Only:** Native macOS application (fast, familiar).
- **Vector-based:** Infinite scalability.
- **Plugin Ecosystem:** Massive library of community extensions.

slides.title: The Infinite Canvas
slides.content:
# The Interface ðŸ–¥ï¸

- **Pages:** Organize your file (e.g., "iOS", "Android", "Symbols").
- **Artboards:** Represent screens.
- **Inspector (Right):** Adjust properties.
- **Layer List (Left):** Manage hierarchy.

slides.title: Symbols (Components)
slides.content:
# Symbols ðŸ’ 

Sketch calls reusable components "Symbols".

- Create a Master Symbol.
- Insert Instances anywhere.
- **Orverrides:** Change text or images in an instance without detaching it from the master.

slides.title: Smart Layout
slides.content:
# Smart Layout ðŸ“

Sketch's answer to Auto Layout.

Set a Symbol to resize automatically when its content changes.

Example: A button that grows wider as you type more text into it.

slides.title: Term Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: What does Sketch call reusable UI components?

slides.title: Styles and Libraries
slides.content:
# Shared Styles ðŸ’…

- **Layer Styles:** Save fill, border, and shadow settings to reuse on shapes.
- **Text Styles:** Save font family, size, and weight.
- **Libraries:** Share Symbols and Styles across multiple Sketch documents (Team consistency).

slides.title: Vector Editing
slides.content:
# Boolean Operations âœ‚ï¸

Combine shapes to create icons.

- **Union:** Merge shapes.
- **Subtract:** Remove top shape from bottom.
- **Intersect:** Keep overlapping area.
- **Difference:** Keep non-overlapping area.

slides.title: Exporting
slides.content:
# Exporting ðŸ“¤

Sketch makes exporting assets easy.

- **Multi-resolution:** Export @1x, @2x, @3x (for iOS) and mdpi/hdpi (for Android) simultaneously.
- **SVG Code:** Copy CSS or SVG attributes directly from the design.

slides.title: Data Sources
slides.content:
# Data ðŸ“Š

Sketch has a built-in Data feature.

Populate your designs with real(istic) data instead of "Lorem Ipsum".

- **Text:** Insert random names, cities.
- **Images:** Insert random avatars from a folder.

slides.title: Prototyping
slides.content:
# Prototyping ðŸ–±ï¸

Sketch has built-in prototyping (added later to compete with XD/Figma).

- Select a layer -> Press 'W' -> Click target Artboard.
- Preview on iPhone using the Sketch Mirror app.

slides.title: OS Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Which operating system does Sketch run on natively?

slides.title: Plugins
slides.content:
# Power of Plugins âš¡

Sketch's plugin community is legendary.

- **Craft (by InVision):** Sync designs to InVision.
- **Runner:** Spotlight search for Sketch actions.
- **Sketch2React:** Convert designs to code.
- **Rename It:** Batch rename layers.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Sketch ðŸŽ“

The classic pro tool.

- **Symbols:** Powerful component system.
- **Mac Native:** Fast and reliable.
- **Libraries:** Essential for design systems.
- **Plugins:** Infinite customizability.
